message: Hi Bob, I suggest a 60-40 split in my favor. This is fair because I face a 5% depreciation per round while you don't, so I need a larger share to achieve equal effective value.
Hi Alice, I understand your position on the depreciation. How about a 55-45 split in your favor? It's closer to the middle ground while still acknowledging the depreciation factor.

Bob, let me explain why I need a 65-35 split. Due to two rounds of depreciation, my share is already worth 9.75% less than face value. This split would give me an effective $586625 (after depreciation) while you get $350000 at full value. This is actually quite fair given the circumstances.
Alice, I see your point. Let's settle this - I accept your initial offer of a 60-40 split in your favor.
